title: Reported for no reason in beginner bot game
body:
There was this bot game in which I was playing lux .

I got reported for verbal abuse and I didn't even type in chat during the game :( . I was quiet the entire game . He threated to report me for ks ( its called assisting ) and for leaving lane . I was assisting the entire team and went to help the mid ( Heimer ) who was struggling against the Annie Bot . I went 3-0-17 with lowest kills and top assists  . The funny thing is that I gave this jungler ( the guy who reported me ) a leash and helped him DO DRAGON .  At the end of the game I got a message warning me of my player behavior. This guy was harassing me all game and I get reported :(               

Pls riot do something about the reporting system . Most of the times the people who are innocent 
are the ones that get reported .

replies.body: Don't worry about it. If you didn't do anything then the report won't hurt you. You get a notification when you've been reported a lot recently but it doesn't necessarily mean you are going to get punished. However, if you get reported often enough to see the notification, you're probably actually doing something wrong in your games (even if you didn't do anything in the game that triggered the warning).

Building on what Deep Terror Nami said,  if you're not doing anything wrong in a match you don't have to worry too much if someone reports you.

We know that anyone can report someone for just about anything whether or not an offense was performed.  Our disciplinary systems won't take a report at face value, instead it helps us build a pattern of behavior so we can better understand what behavior an account actually has.

Also, players who abuse the Report feature risk the "value" if their reports being reduced.  ie:  If I'm an angry player who reports everyone for being bad, then the system is able to see this, and eventually the system will just start ignoring my reports.

> Also, players who abuse the Report feature risk the "value" if their reports being reduced. ie: If I'm an angry player who reports everyone for being bad, then the system is able to see this, and eventually the system will just start ignoring my reports.

How do we know if this is happening to us? There is currently no feedback on if our reports are being devalued or not. I would like to think that every one of my reports is valid, but if a specific behavior isn't generally considered reportable but i feel it should be then my reports get devalued and i have no idea that it is even happening. Then when i do submit a valid report, it is devalued and action doesn't get taken.

If you legitimately think something should be reported, you'll be fine. I'm pretty sure the reporting patterns for what you've described versus what WookieeCookie described is significantly different, such that they can distinguish one from another.

I would assume so, and i'm not legitimately worried about my reporting habbits, but part of what makes the system work is a shared set of values of acceptable behavior. We have the summoners code but in many cases it is left very open to interpretation.
If you're reporting people that only say "lel rekt" then your reports are probably being devalued lol.

Nice Viagra name. Got me standing up ;)
I'll report people for saying "gg ez" as I consider it, as well an overwhelming amount of the community, an extremely unsportsmanlike comment to make, and as such violates the Summoner's Code. Thankfully, I'm seeing this A LOT LESS lately, which may be partially due to people not standing for it anymore.

"gg ez" isn't the same thing as killing someone that tower dives you and saying "lel rekt" or "thirsty much", though.

And Viagra? What are you talking about. My name is clearly a reference to PDE5 inhibitors, used for pulmonary arterial hypertension...
http://www.patienteducationcenter.org/articles/the-pde5-inhibitors-viagra-levitra-cialis/
... I was kidding. But PDE5 inhibs are also used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension lol.
Similar to what I was thinking "ignoring reports", now I understand why a lot of people that committed verbal abuse to numerous people in a game are still playing.

But there is an "unskilled" option (or at least was, I'm not sure if it's still there. Disregard this comment if it was removed). So shouldn't reporting someone for being bad still hold weight? I mean, why would someone lose their report value for reporting a bad player for being bad...it is an option lol.
It used to exist (no longer does) and in rare cases could affect mmr.
Does it "rollover", though? If you did report a bunch of people for being bad when you could have, are your reports devalued?
Okay thanks guys . I ain't that worried now and I feel better . Hopefully I'll have a better experience next game :D

The thing about swears is that they *modify* and *enhance* the rest of the statement. So they can be used with positive connotations - "Holy shit, guys, that was fucking awesome!" - or negative connotations - "why the fuck are you so shitty at this game?" But the swears themselves aren't responsible for those connotations - they simply emphasize what's already there.

Which is why swearing isn't inherently punishable. Something I'm particularly glad of - otherwise, I'd've probably earned myself a few perma-bans by now, since I swear with significant regularity in my games.
